Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with clinical sepsis of unknown origin given the appropriate IV antibiotics according to the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Sepsis of any origin (eg urosepsis, pulmonary sepsis etc), sepsis syndrome or septic shock with no clear anatomic site. Include fungaemia (candidemia) with septic symptoms

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with clinical sepsis of unknown origin prescribed the total daily dose of IV empiric antibiotics recommended in the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Sepsis of any origin (eg urosepsis, pulmonary sepsis etc), sepsis syndrome or septic shock with no clear anatomic site. Include fungaemia (candidemia) with septic symptoms

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with bacterial meningitis given the appropriate IV antibiotics according to the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Infections of the Central Nervous System

Indicator: Proportion of patients with all bacterial CAP given IV/oral Watch antibiotics.
gPPS Definition: Pneumonia or LRTI (lower respiratory tract infections)

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with any CAP given the appropriate IV antibiotics according to the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book
gPPS Definition: Pneumonia or LRTI (lower respiratory tract infections)

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with intrabdominal infections (IAIs) (i.e. cholecystitis, cholangitis, acute appendicitis, acute diverticulitis) given IV antibiotics.
gPPS Definition: Intra-Abdominal sepsis including hepatobiliary, intra-abdominal abscess etc
ABX-INFECTION-1: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, Acute diverticulitis (mild cases)
ABX-INFECTION-2: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (mild/severe cases)
ABX-INFECTION-3: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (mild/severe cases)
ABX-INFECTION-4: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (mild/severe cases)
ABX-INFECTION-5: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (mild cases)
ABX-INFECTION-6: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (severe cases)
ABX-INFECTION-7: Acute cholecystitis & cholangitis, Pyogenic liver abscess, Acute appendicitis, or Acute diverticulitis (severe cases)

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with upper UTIs prescribed the total daily dose of IV antibiotics in the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Upper UTI including catheter related urinary tract infection, pyelonephritis

Indicator: Proportion of patients with all upper UTIs given IV/oral Watch antibiotics.
gPPS Definition: Upper UTI including catheter related urinary tract infection, pyelonephritis

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with upper urinary tract infection (UTI) given IV antibiotics.
gPPS Definition: Upper UTI including catheter related urinary tract infection, pyelonephritis

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with complicated skin and soft tissue infections (cSSTIs) (necrotizing fascitis, pyomiositis) given the appropriate IV antibiotics according to the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Skin and Soft Tissue: Cellulitis, wound including surgical site infection, deep soft tissue not involving  bone e.g., infected pressure or diabetic ulcer, abscess

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with complicated skin and soft tissue infections (cSSTIs) (necrotizing fascitis, pyomiositis) prescribed the total daily dose of  IV antibiotics in the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Skin and Soft Tissue: Cellulitis, wound including surgical site infection, deep soft tissue not involving  bone e.g., infected pressure or diabetic ulcer, abscess

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with osteoarticular infections (acute bacterial osteomyelitis, septic arthritis) given IV Access antibiotic.
gPPS Definition: Bone/Joint Infections: Septic arthritis (including prosthetic joint), osteomyelitis

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with osteoarticular infections (acute bacterial osteomyelitis, septic arthritis) given IV Watch antibiotic.
gPPS Definition: Bone/Joint Infections: Septic arthritis (including prosthetic joint), osteomyelitis

Indicator: Proportion of patients presenting with osteoarticular infections (acute bacterial osteomyelitis, septic arthritis) prescribed the total daily dose of IV antibiotics in the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book.
gPPS Definition: Bone/Joint Infections: Septic arthritis (including prosthetic joint), osteomyelitis

Indicator: Proportion of patients who received the appropriate IV surgical prophylaxis according to the WHO AWaRe Antibiotic Book for bowel surgery/clean or clean-contaminated procedure/contaminated procedure/urologic procedure.
Diagnosis site: CNS, EYE, ENT, RESP, CVS, GI, BJ, UTI, OBGY
